content: लौकिक {%<ab>a.</ab>%} (की|{%<ab>f.</ab>%}) [लोके विदितः प्रसिद्धो हितो वा ठण्] {@--1@} Worldly, mundane, terrestrial, earthly. {@--2@} General, common, usual, ordinary, vulgar; <ls>U. 1. 10.</ls> {@--3@} Of every-day life, generally accepted, popular, customary; <ls>Ku. 7. 88.</ls> {@--4@} Temporal, secular (<ab>opp.</ab> आर्ष or शास्त्रीय); <ls>Ms. 3. 282.</ls> {@--5@} Not sacred, profane (as a word or its sense); वाक्यं द्विविधं वैदिकं लौकिकं च <ls>T. S.</ls>; (see <ls>Mbh.</ls> quoted under लोक <ls n="T. S.">8</ls>). {@--6@} Belonging to the world of; as in ब्रह्मलौकिक. --काः (<ab>pl.</ab>) {@--1@} Ordinary men, men of the world. {@--2@} The human race, mankind. --कं Any general or worldly custom.
